intro: Cuphea flava, commonly known as the yellow whorled cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in whorls along the stems. The plant has succulent, hairy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Cuphea flava is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
